revised_title: A Description of the Aponensian Baths and Their Salt Production
tldr: The author, Mr. Dodington, describes the Aponensian Baths near Padua and their unique salt production process. The salt is gathered from the water using wooden instruments and is used for various purposes, including washing clothes. The author also mentions the salt collected from the stones, gravel, and earth around the baths, which has no taste but is similar in appearance to the gathered salt.
